thread.title: Kevin Durant lobs alley-oop to Russell Westbrook
thread.title_full: Kevin Durant lobs alley-oop to Russell Westbrook

author: DANIEL POPPER
title: Kevin Durant lobs alley-oop to Russell Westbrook
text:
Updated: Sunday, February 19, 2017, 9:18 PM 
Kevin Durant and Russell Westbrook are putting their differences aside for the All-Star Game. 
Westbrook joined Durant on the court for the Western Conference about midway through the first quarter Sunday in New Orleans, and the duo connected on an alley-oop shortly after. 
Westbrook passed to a cutting Durant in the middle of the paint. Durant spun and offered a one-handed lob back to Westbrook, who flushed it home to cheers from the crowd - and fellow players. 
"Oh my god what just happened?!" Steph Curry, Durant's Warriors teammate, said on the West bench after watching the dunk. Top 5 moment of the NBA season right here: Draymond, Boogie, DeAndre lead cheering after Durant-to-Westbrook pic.twitter.com/oWbaHJ8Dqn â€” Jason McIntyre (@jasonrmcintyre) February 20, 2017 
According to ESPN, the Kings' Demarcus Cousins told Durant, "I'm proud of you, man." 
Draymond Green said "it was cute" during an interview on TNT during the game. 
At the next timeout, Durant and Westbrook's fellow West All-Stars erupted, spraying water while jumping in huddle. Both Durant and Westbrook were smiling. Russell Westbrook. (Ronald Martinez/Getty Images) 
Just last weekend, the two superstars engaged in heated exchanges during the Warriors' 130-114 win over the Thunder, and they haven't been on speaking terms. This week in New Orleans, Westbrook refused to answer questions about playing alongside Durant for the West. 
But there may be hope for a mended relationship, after all. Join the Conversation:
